intro: Pteracanthus lamium, commonly known as the red deadnettle, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Lamiaceae family. It is characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves that are often hairy and have a distinctive reddish coloration. The plant produces small, two-lipped flowers that are typically pink or purple, arranged in whorls along the stem. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Pteracanthus lamium is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
